result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon M. Huppert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $61.35 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $6.14 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon M. Huppert

defendant.name: Huppert, Shannon M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution to Royal Supermarket - Ck No 010973

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Shannon M. Huppert in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of appearance warrant withdrawn.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def requests to speak with the ADA on resolution without counsel.  Off Record for Def to speak directly with ADA.  Back of Record @ 1:12 PM:  Per ADA, resolution reached.  Notes for the record that full Rest has been PIF.  Recommends Court Costs as penalty.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Imposes Court Costs only plus DNA Surcharge.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Def must complete ID process.  Appeal Rights Given.
Voluntary Appearance Authorized by the Court
from Defendant Re: Request for Voluntary Appearance

Case Called @ 2:28 PM: Defendant Shannon M. Huppert not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
